Articles.Content:
I was building a space station today. Added a structural/crew module, and a solar arm. I undocked the solar arm to fix its rotation, but SAS was fighting me to the point where i was TRANSLATED away from my docking port, in the wrong axis. I decided I didn't want to try docking it again, so I tried loading a quicksave. I was lucky I even had a quicksave at all, but it was outdated. I didn't even finish the first module yet!

I leave one question to myself: HOW COULD I FORGET TO QUICKSAVE?

Aaaw man that is so frustrating!

 

I moved this little report to Mission Reports
Try loading the persistent save.It might be more recent than the past one

On 8/20/2018 at 3:12 PM, KerbolExplorer said:

Try loading the persistent save.It might be more recent than the past one

I did load from the persistent save. For some reason, KSP didn't autosave later. ;(
I never quicksave, but most of you know that of me . . .
